definition.name: SCP Command to Transfer Files
definition.description: Easily transfer files and folders using the SCP command in Linux.
definition.author: Bo-Yi Wu

inputs.name: host
inputs.description: Remote host address for SCP (e.g., example.com or 192.168.1.1).

inputs.name: port
inputs.description: Remote SSH port for SCP. Default: 22.

inputs.name: username
inputs.description: Username for SSH authentication.

inputs.name: password
inputs.description: Password for SSH authentication (not recommended; use SSH keys if possible).

inputs.name: protocol
inputs.description: IP protocol to use. Valid values: 'tcp', 'tcp4', or 'tcp6'. Default: tcp.

inputs.name: timeout
inputs.description: Timeout for establishing SSH connection to the remote host. Default: 30s.

inputs.name: command_timeout
inputs.description: Timeout for the SCP command execution. Default: 10m.

inputs.name: key
inputs.description: Content of the SSH private key (e.g., the raw content of ~/.ssh/id_rsa).

inputs.name: key_path
inputs.description: Path to the SSH private key file.

inputs.name: passphrase
inputs.description: Passphrase for the SSH private key, if required.

inputs.name: fingerprint
inputs.description: SHA256 fingerprint of the host's public key. If not set, host key verification is skipped (not recommended for production).

inputs.name: use_insecure_cipher
inputs.description: Enable additional, less secure ciphers for compatibility. Not recommended unless required.

inputs.name: target
inputs.description: Target directory path on the remote server. Must be a directory.

inputs.name: source
inputs.description: List of files or directories to transfer (local paths).

inputs.name: rm
inputs.description: Remove the target directory on the server before uploading new data.

inputs.name: debug
inputs.description: Enable debug messages for troubleshooting.

inputs.name: strip_components
inputs.description: Remove the specified number of leading path elements when extracting files.

inputs.name: overwrite
inputs.description: Use the --overwrite flag with tar to overwrite existing files.

inputs.name: tar_dereference
inputs.description: Use the --dereference flag with tar to follow symlinks.

inputs.name: tar_tmp_path
inputs.description: Temporary path for the tar file on the destination host.

inputs.name: tar_exec
inputs.description: Path to the tar executable on the destination host. Default: tar.

inputs.name: proxy_host
inputs.description: Remote host address for SSH proxy.

inputs.name: proxy_port
inputs.description: SSH proxy port. Default: 22.

inputs.name: proxy_username
inputs.description: Username for SSH proxy authentication.

inputs.name: proxy_password
inputs.description: Password for SSH proxy authentication.

inputs.name: proxy_passphrase
inputs.description: Passphrase for the SSH proxy private key, if required.

inputs.name: proxy_timeout
inputs.description: Timeout for establishing SSH connection to the proxy host. Default: 30s.

inputs.name: proxy_key
inputs.description: Content of the SSH proxy private key (e.g., the raw content of ~/.ssh/id_rsa).

inputs.name: proxy_key_path
inputs.description: Path to the SSH proxy private key file.

inputs.name: proxy_fingerprint
inputs.description: SHA256 fingerprint of the proxy host's public key. If not set, host key verification is skipped (not recommended for production).

inputs.name: proxy_use_insecure_cipher
inputs.description: Enable additional, less secure ciphers for the proxy connection. Not recommended unless required.

inputs.name: curl_insecure
inputs.description: When true, uses the --insecure option with curl for insecure downloads.

inputs.name: capture_stdout
inputs.description: When true, captures and returns standard output from the commands as action output.

inputs.name: version
inputs.description: The version of drone-scp to use.

outputs.name: stdout
outputs.description: Standard output of the executed commands when capture_stdout is enabled.
